objenome.solution.dependency

Interface ConfigurableBuilder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Builder, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClassBuilder

    public interface ConfigurableBuilder
extends Builder
    An IoC factory that knows how to create instances and can be configured by accepting values for its constructor and properties (setters). It can also be intercepted right after it creates an instance and right before it releases an instance through the Interceptor interface. It also supports constructor and property values that are dependencies, in other words, they come from the container itself.
    Author:
    sergio.oliveira.jr@gmail.com
    See Also:
    Interceptor

    • Method Detail

      • addInitValue

        ConfigurableBuilder addInitValue(java.lang.Object value)
        Add a constructor parameter to be used when the bean is instantiated. It can be called more than once to use constructors with more than one argument.
        Parameters:
        value - A parameter value to be used by a constructor.
        Returns:
        The factory itself. (Fluent API)

      • addInitPrimitive

        ConfigurableBuilder addInitPrimitive(java.lang.Object value)
        Add a constructor parameter that is a primitive to be used when the bean is instantiated. It can be called more than once to use constructors with more than one argument.

        Note: This method is seldom necessary and should be used if and only if you have a constructor that mixes Wrappers and primitives, like below:

         public AObject(int x, Integer i, Boolean b, boolean f) { ... }
        Parameters:
        value - A parameter value to be used by a constructor. Must be a primitive that will be autoboxed.
        Returns:
        The factory itself. (Fluent API)

      • constructorUse

        ConfigurableBuilder constructorUse(java.lang.Object key)
        Add a constructor parameter that is a dependency, in other words, it gets its value from the container. When the object is created the dependency will be obtained from the container.
        Parameters:
        key - The key used to get an instance from the container
        Returns:
        The set of possible builders itself. (Fluent API)

      • useZeroArgumentConstructor

        ConfigurableBuilder useZeroArgumentConstructor()
        In case you want to force the use of a zero argument constructor and avoid any ambiguity when choosing the constructor to use. This method is seldom necessary and should be used in the rare cases that the container cannot correctly determine the constructor you want to use due to auto-wiring.
        Returns:
        The factory itself. (Fluent API)

      • addPropertyValue

        ConfigurableBuilder addPropertyValue(java.lang.String name,
                                     java.lang.Object value)
        Add a property to be injected through a setter when the factory instantiates an object.
        Parameters:
        name - The property name.
        value - The property value.
        Returns:
        The factory itself. (Fluent API)

      • addPropertyDependency

        ConfigurableBuilder addPropertyDependency(java.lang.String property)
        Add a setter property that is a dependency, in other words, its value will be obtained from the container. The property name and the dependency name are the same. If they are different you can use the other version of addPropertyDependency that accepts both values.
        Parameters:
        property - The dependency name which is equal to the property name.
        Returns:
        The factory itself. (Fluent API)

      • addPropertyDependency

        ConfigurableBuilder addPropertyDependency(java.lang.String property,
                                          java.lang.Object key)
        Add a setter property that is a dependency, in other words, its value will be obtained from the container. The property name and the dependency name are different.
        Parameters:
        property - The property that will be injected by the container.
        key - The dependency name, in other words, the key used to get a bean from the container.
        Returns:
        The factory itself. (Fluent API)
